name: SearchTerminalActions
description:
Retrieve a filtered list of terminal action requests.

Use this tool to get a list of terminal action requests created by your account. Terminal actions are accessible for 30 days.

parameters.name: device_id_filter
parameters.description: Filter TerminalActions by a specific device ID. Leave blank to include all devices.

value_schema.description:
`TerminalAction`s associated with a specific device. If no device is specified then all
`TerminalAction`s for the merchant will be displayed.

parameters.name: start_time_rfc3339
parameters.description: The start datetime in RFC 3339 format for filtering terminal actions.

value_schema.description:
A datetime value in RFC 3339 format indicating when the time range
starts.

parameters.name: end_time_rfc3339
parameters.description: A datetime in RFC 3339 format indicating the end of the time range.

value_schema.description:
A datetime value in RFC 3339 format indicating when the time range
ends.

parameters.name: filter_terminal_action_status
parameters.description: Filter results by the status of the TerminalAction (e.g., `PENDING`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `CANCEL_REQUESTED`, `CANCELED`, `COMPLETED`).

value_schema.description:
Filter results with the desired status of the `TerminalAction`
Options: `PENDING`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `CANCEL_REQUESTED`, `CANCELED`, `COMPLETED`

parameters.name: terminal_action_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of terminal action, such as 'QR_CODE', 'PING', etc. This helps filter actions by their purpose.

value_schema.description: Describes the type of this unit and indicates which field contains the unit information. This is an ‘open’ enum.

parameters.name: result_sort_order
parameters.description: Defines the order ('DESC' or 'ASC') for sorting the terminal action requests.

value_schema.description: The order (e.g., chronological or alphabetical) in which results from a request are returned.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A pagination cursor from a previous response to retrieve the next set of results.

value_schema.description:
A pagination cursor returned by a previous call to this endpoint.
Provide this to retrieve the next set of results for the original query.
See [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/pagination) for more
information.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of results returned for a single request.

value_schema.description: Limit the number of results returned for a single request.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the squareup API.
